text: (bright upbeat music)

- We make a justifiable claim
that security is job zero,
and that's not just a claim.

It's reflected all the way
up and down the org chart,
up and down the operating plans.
- We fundamentally bake enterprise-grade,
rock solid-security into everything we do

in any service from the
moment we start developing it.
(bright upbeat music)

- This is a field where
we're constantly learning.

If I'm not around people
who are not teaching me,
I'm falling behind in security.

And so we need people who are
constantly raising that bar.
(bright upbeat music)
- If anyone reached out to me at any time

and asked in meet with
me to talk about career,

to talk about what they could
be doing, how they think,

how I got to where I
was, what I was doing,

I always committed to a
30 minute one-off meeting
with every single individual.
- What we're really looking for
is looking for the same thing,

regardless of the
technicality of the position
that the person goes into
or the technological requirements.
We're looking for high-judgment people.
We're looking for people

who are used to operating
in ambiguous situations.
- If you have demonstrated in your career,
in your hobbies,

that you're curious,
you're willing to dig in,
you poke at unknown areas,

you try to optimize
and make things better,

like, those are the kind
of things we want to hear.
(bright upbeat music)
(bright upbeat music fades)
